ring MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Rep. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While

Shirley Houston said that because she knows Mike Pence is a godly man, she is sure he prayed and sought the leadership of the Lord in making his decision not to run for president in 2012.

News Washington Bureau The Environmental Protection Agency and Chrysler will announce a new research and development project next week in Debbie Stabenow Arbor. EPA Administrator Lisa Jackson will join Chrysler Group CEO Sergio Marchionne to announce a research and development project to explore and evaluate an innovative drivetrain technology for light duty vehicles, the EPA said in a statement.
